ygData.subject: Re: Reconsider the Sit-in!
ygData.msgSnippet: I hope that people on that sever who can hunt the planes now know not to hunt on that day, because it can mean their deaths...continue with the sit-in. Niomar,
ygData.messageBody:
I hope that people on that sever who can hunt the
planes now know not to hunt on that day, because it
can mean their deaths...continue with the sit-in.

Niomar, 13th Training Dwaven Cleric of Xegony.

P.S. You are asking the majority of clerics (over 3k
in people, I'm am guessing) to not do this because
maybe 20 people on the Fenn Ro server want to hunt in
the planes on that day?...it is not happening.

--- BROWNCA9@... wrote:
> From: BROWNCA9@...
>
> Read this and reconsider the sit-in!
>
> Greebo (Stratics Moderator) said:
> -----
> I have a very old friend who contributes to the
> Guide program. Naturally, I
> can't say who, but in the interest of preventing a
> similar fiasco as with
> the Monk sit-in, I will confirm that players in
> Fenin's Fear Plane were
> lagged out due to over-loading network resources on
> the server which houses
> both Fear and West Freeport.
>
> The server didn't crash, the network resources were
> overloaded, and so
> people lagged out, leaving the Fear Plane with a
> half-linkdead party, which
> died, followed by people reconnecting into Fear as a
> now very lonely, and
> shortly after very dead, person.
>
> Fear plane did not crash itself - that would have
> made the players safe -
> because Fear does not populate for some time after a
> reboot. Instead, the
> overload of players on the server caused the tragic
> and needless deaths of
> people who just wanted to enjoy the game, and made
> their corpse recovery
> even harsher.
>
> Clerics and Necromancers, I urge you - find a better
> way to protest. You are
> going down a path which will, again, bring needless
> suffering on those who
> are not participating. Non-violent protest is
> admirable, but if it causes
> death, its no longer non-violent, is it?
> -----
>
> I believe a sit-in, now that it is known that it
> causes problems to other
> players, is not a good way to protest. Please invent
> another form of
> peaceful protest, for the sake of others!
>
> ~ Briza X`Ris ~
> ~ Mistress of Innoruuk ~
> ~ Fennin RO ~
>
